intro: Landolphia dubardii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental and agricultural plant in its native region.
